meanings.definition: The quality or state of being transitive.
meanings.sent1: Understanding transitivities helps in solving math problems.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of transitivities using simple examples.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled when the textbook defined transitivities in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: In the world of mathematics, transitivities are like connecting dots to form a line.
meanings.sent5: Her explanation of transitivities made the complex topic easier to grasp.

meanings.definition: The property of a relation that holds between three elements if it holds between the first and second and between the second and third.
meanings.sent1: The transitivities of the mathematical equation were clearly illustrated on the board.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the transitivities of the relationship between the three variables is crucial in data analysis.
meanings.sent3: The book on logic puzzles humorously explained the concept of transitivities.
meanings.sent4: The transitivities in this problem are like stepping stones leading to the solution.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing the transitivities in a diagram can make it easier to comprehend the relationship.
